meanings.definition: The quality or state of being stern.
meanings.sent1: Her sternnesses in discipline kept the classroom orderly.
meanings.sent2: His sternnesses as a leader earned him respect from his team.
meanings.sent3: The sternnesses of the librarian made the children giggle nervously.
meanings.sent4: The sternnesses of the judge's gaze seemed to pierce through the defendant.
meanings.sent5: The sternnesses of the storm clouds warned of an impending downpour.

meanings.sent1: The sternnesses of her reprimand left no room for argument.
meanings.sent2: His sternnesses during the meeting made everyone pay attention.
meanings.sent3: The sternnesses of the traffic officer made the drivers slow down.
meanings.sent4: The sternnesses of the coach's instructions pushed the team to perform better.
meanings.sent5: The sternnesses of the security guard kept the premises safe and secure.

meanings.sent1: The sternnesses of his expression revealed his disapproval.
meanings.sent2: Her sternnesses in negotiations showed her determination.
meanings.sent3: The sternnesses of the statue made it seem almost lifelike.
meanings.sent4: The sternnesses of the mountain range hinted at its ancient strength.
meanings.sent5: The sternnesses of the old oak tree commanded respect from all who passed by.
